title: ALS Ice Bucket Challenge
summary: How a grassroots social media campaign raised over $220 million for ALS research.
content:
Case Study: ALS Ice Bucket Challenge

In 2014, the ALS Association's Ice Bucket Challenge became one of the most successful social media PR campaigns in history, raising $220 million globally.

Mechanics of Success

The challenge was simple, participatory, and shareable. It leveraged peer-to-peer nomination, celebrity participation, and genuine emotional storytelling about ALS sufferers.

PR Lessons

Earned media amplified far beyond paid placements. The campaign succeeded because it empowered participants to become brand advocates. Authenticity and simplicity drove virality.

Key Learnings

Social media PR thrives on participatory mechanics, emotional resonance, and clear calls to action. Celebrity endorsement can amplify, but grassroots authenticity is the foundation.
